availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas L. Starling (Christian County, Kentucky, druggist.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, druggist. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel M. Starling and Elizabeth Lewis Starling. Married to Frances "Nannie" Killebrew Starling on April 28, 1857. Father of Mary "Nannie" Starling, Elizabeth Starling, and Katherine Starling. Resident of Christian County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in 1850. Druggist in Christian County in 1860. Household owned fourteen enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 422B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, pp. 688-689.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 277
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994032, Christian County Marriages, pp. 57-58.
"Kentucky Knowledge," Semi-Weekly South Kentuckian (Hopkinsville, KY), May 27, 1884, p. 4.
William Henry Perrin, ed., County of Christian, Kentucky: Historical and Biographical(Louisville: F.A. Batey Publishing Co., 1884), p. 417.
Albert Mack Sterling, The Sterling Genealogy Vol. II (New York: Grafton Press, 1909), 1095.
"Thomas Lyne Starling (1836-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 86672148, accessed July 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86672148.
